info.name: openEHR_Ehrscape NHS Hack Day
info.description:
API Calls for Ehrscape-based, openEHR CDRs (Clinical Data Repositories) including NHS Code4Health platform, Operon Cloud Platform,the Marand Ehrscape platform, and Ripple EtherCis platform.

For general guidance on the use of this API see [here](https://github.com/freshehr/postman-ehrscape/blob/master/README.md)

This collection relies on an associated environment file to setup environment variables.

## Ehrscape Authorization
For testing purposes, Ehrscape Authorisation is normally handled on a per-call basis by passing a Basic Auth string in the `Authorization` header.

However it is also possible to perform authorisation by creating a session token via the /session POST call and `Ehr-Session` header. In order for the session tokens to be used, you must change the `SessionHeader` environment variable from `Ehr-Session-disabled` to `Ehr-Session`.

i.e.

1. To enable Basic Auth authentication set the environment variable `SessionHeader=Ehr-Session-disabled`

2. To enable session token authentication set the environment variable
`SessionHeader=Ehr-Session`
 
You will have to run the /session POST call once per session to store the Ehr-Session token.
 
## Operon Cloud Platform API Authorization

Access to the Operon Cloud Platform requires you to pass the Operon Ehrscape Sandbox API Authorization which you were issued, as an additional ``Auth-Token`` header. 

This is supported in this Postman collection - you just need to ensure that you populate the header directly or via the ``Auth-Token`` Postman environment variable (normally supplied as part of Operon Cloud registration process).

item.name: Create new EHR, linked to subjectId

request.description:
Returns an OpenEhr template in its web-appropriate representation (as a JSON object).

A note on languages: the web template will be generated with localized names for all the languages that the underlying template supports, unless it is specified differently via the defaultLanguage and languages query parameters, both of which are optional. The defaultLanguage parameter determines the default name for each web template node (the localizedName property), whereas the languages parameter will generate additional localized names inside the localizedNames map for all the languages listed in this parameter (different languages should be separated by a comma: en,sl,no). See the example below.

Note that the underlying OpenEhr template needs to support these languages, or else a 400 error (bad request) will be returned (TMPL-3061).

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter	Value	Description	Parameter Type	Data Type
templateId
required
	The ID of the template to load.	path	string
defaultLanguage
optional
	The default language to generate the web template with.	query	string
languages
optional
	Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.	query	string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.	query	enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.	query	enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

Resource Url

https://ehrscape.code-4-health.org/rest/v1/template/{templateId}/example
Parameters

Parameter	Value	Description	Parameter Type	Data Type
templateId
required
	The ID of the template to load.	path	string
defaultLanguage
optional
	The default language to generate the web template with.	query	string
languages
optional
	Other languages to include in the web template, separated by a comma.	query	string
format
optional

The format of JSON representation of the example composition to return. Default: FLAT.	query	enum
exampleFilter
optional

The type of example to produce - intended for input (sent to the server), output (received back from the server) etc.	query	enum
Try it out!
Implementation Notes

Returns an example of data values for a ThinkEhr web template.

This method will show all the web template paths that can be filled out in order to successfully save a composition in the web template format. It will do its best to generate legal exampledata values for those paths, taking into account the data type and validation constraints.

Two parameters control the output of this call. The format parameter controls whether the produced output will be the web template composition values in either the FLAT or the STRUCTURED (hierarchical) JSON format. The exampleFilter parameter controls whether the example will show the values as they would be submitted to the server (INPUT) or received from the server (OUTPUT), since the latter one is more detailed.

The two language parameters determine the languages that the web template will be generated with before its example values will be produced and returned. See the documentation for the {templateId} call for more information on web template languages.

        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">The General Practitioner Assessment of Cognition (GPCOG) screening test.</items>
          <items id="text">GPCOG screening test</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Event Series</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
          <items id="text">Point in time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">Narrative record of factors that may have contributed to the score.</items>
          <items id="text">Confounding factors</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0007">
          <items id="comment">For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.</items>
          <items id="description">Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.</items>
          <items id="text">Extension</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0008">
          <items id="description">Statement whether the patient gives a correct or incorrect answer when asked to give the exact date today.</items>
          <items id="text">Time orientation</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0009">
          <items id="description">The patient gives an incorrect answer.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="description">The patient gives the correct answer.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0011">
          <items id="description">Statement whether or not the patient marks all the correct numbers to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.</items>
          <items id="text">Clock drawing - all numbers</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0012">
          <items id="description">The patient does not mark all the correct numbers to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0013">
          <items id="description">The patient marks all the correct number to indicate the hours of the clock with the correct spacing.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="description">Statement whether the patient correctly marks in hands a specified time (i.e. 10 minutes past 11 o'clock) on a clock face.</items>
          <items id="text">Clock drawing - specific time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0015">
          <items id="description">The patient does not correctly mark in hands a specified time (11.10) on a clock face.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0016">
          <items id="description">The patient correctly marks in hands a specified time (11.10) on a clock face.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0017">
          <items id="description">Statement whether the patient gives a correct and specific answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently. Recently = in the last week. If a general answer is given, e.g. "lot of rain", "war", further details should be asked for.</items>
          <items id="text">Information</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0018">
          <items id="description">Patient does not give specific and correct answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0019">
          <items id="description">Patient gives specific and correct answer when asked to say something that happened in the news recently.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0020">
          <items id="description">Statement whether patient correctly recalls first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Recall first name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0021">
          <items id="description">Patient does not correctly recall first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0022">
          <items id="description">Patient correctly recalls first name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0023">
          <items id="description">Statement whether patient correctly recalls surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Recall surname</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0024">
          <items id="description">Patient does not correctly recall surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0025">
          <items id="description">Patient correctly recalls surname of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0027">
          <items id="description">Statement whether patient correctly recalls house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Recall house number</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0028">
          <items id="description">Patient does not correctly recall house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0029">
          <items id="description">Patient correctly recalls house number of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0030">
          <items id="description">Statement whether patient correctly recalls street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Recall street name</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0031">
          <items id="description">Patient does not correctly recall street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0032">
          <items id="description">Patient correctly recalls street name of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0033">
          <items id="description">Statement whether patient correctly recalls locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Recall locality or town</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0034">
          <items id="description">Patient does not correctly recall locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Incorrect</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0035">
          <items id="description">Patient correctly recalls locality or town of name and address phrase given at the start of the test.</items>
          <items id="text">Correct</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0036">
          <items id="description">The total score from all nine individual scores. If patient scores 9, no significant cognitive impairment and further testing not necessary. If patient scores 5-8, more information required. Proceed with Step 2, informant section. If patient scores 5-8, more information required. Proceed with Step 2, informant section.</items>
          <items id="text">Total score</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0037">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient has more trouble remembering things that have happened recently than he/she used to.</items>
          <items id="text">Trouble remembering</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0038">
          <items id="description">Step 1 of the GPCOG screening test, relating to the patient examination.</items>
          <items id="text">Step 1: patient examination</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0039">
          <items id="description">Step 2 of the GPCOG screening test, relating to the informant interview. This section is required if the total score from Step 1 is between 5 and 8.</items>
          <items id="text">Step 2: informant interview</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0040">
          <items id="description">The patient has more trouble remembering things that have happened recently than he/she used to.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0041">
          <items id="description">The patient does not have more trouble remembering things that have recently happened than he/she used to.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0042">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient has more trouble remembering thigns tha thave happened recently than he/she used to.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0043">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient has more trouble recalling conversations a few days later.</items>
          <items id="text">Trouble recalling conversations</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0044">
          <items id="description">The patient has trouble recalling conversations a few days later.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0045">
          <items id="description">The patient does not have trouble recalling conversations a few days later.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0046">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient has trouble recalling conversations a few days later.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0047">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient, when speaking, has more difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.</items>
          <items id="text">Difficulty finding right words or using wrong words</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0048">
          <items id="description">When speaking, the patient has difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0049">
          <items id="description">When speaking, the patient does not have difficulty in finding the right words and does not tend to use the wrong words more often.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0050">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient, when speaking, has more difficulty in finding the right words or tends to use the wrong words more often.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0051">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs (e.g. paying bills, budgeting).</items>
          <items id="text">Less able to manage money</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0052">
          <items id="description">The patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0053">
          <items id="description">The patient is not less able to manage money and financial affairs.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0054">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient is less able to manage money and financial affairs.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0055">
          <items id="description">The question of whether the patient is less able to manage money or financial affairs is not applicable to this patient.</items>
          <items id="text">Not applicable</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0056">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.</items>
          <items id="text">Less able to manage medication</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0057">
          <items id="description">The patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0058">
          <items id="description">The patient is not less able to manage his/her medication independently.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0059">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0060">
          <items id="description">The question whether the patient is less able to manage his/her medication independently is not relevant to this patient.</items>
          <items id="text">Not applicable</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0061">
          <items id="description">Statement whether, compared to a few years ago, the patient needs more assistance with transport (either private or public). If patient has difficulties only due to physical problems, e.g. bad leg, 'No' should be selected.</items>
          <items id="text">Needs more assistance with transport</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0062">
          <items id="description">The patient needs more assistance with transport.</items>
          <items id="text">Yes</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0063">
          <items id="description">The patient does not need more assistance with transport.</items>
          <items id="text">No</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0064">
          <items id="description">The informant doesn't know whether the patient needs more assistance with transport.</items>
          <items id="text">Don't know</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0065">
          <items id="description">The question whether the patient needs more assistance with transport is not applicable to this patient.</items>
          <items id="text">Not applicable</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0066">
          <items id="description">To get the total score, add the number of items answered 'No', 'Don't know' or 'Not applicable'. A total score of 0-3 indicates cognitive impairment, and standard investigations should be conducted.</items>
          <items id="text">Total score</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0067">
          <items id="description">For other commetns.</items>
          <items id="text">Comment</items>
        </term_definitions>

        <term_definitions code="at0000">
          <items id="description">Additional clinical information used to complete DiADeM assessment.</items>
          <items id="text">YHSCN - DiADeM assessment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0001">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Event Series</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0002">
          <items id="description">A specific date and/or time which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.</items>
          <items id="text">Point in time</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0003">
          <items id="description">@ internal @</items>
          <items id="text">Tree</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0004">
          <items id="comment">The requirement of prompting or supervision of staff constitutes a loss of full independence.</items>
          <items id="description">The patient is no longer fully independent in relation to basic activities of daily living, washing, dressing, feeding and 
attending to own continence needs.</items>
          <items id="text">Functional impairment</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0005">
          <items id="description">The patient is fully independent in relation to basic activities of daily living.</items>
          <items id="text">False</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0006">
          <items id="description">The patient is no longer fully independent in relation to the basic activities of daily living.</items>
          <items id="text">True</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0007">
          <items id="comment">Staff/relatives confirm that in their opinion the patient consistently demonstrates both functional and cognitive 
impairment.</items>
          <items id="description">History of gradual cognitive decline (typically for the last few years) is confirmed by care staff, relatives and medical records.</items>
          <items id="text">Corroborating history</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0008">
          <items id="comment">If patient lacks capacity to consent to bloods, a best interest decision must be made and documented accordingly.
 NB. If intracranial pathology (e.g. subdural haematoma, cerebral tumour) is suspected, referral for a brain scan may be appropriate. Otherwise where dementia is advanced, differential diagnosis is unlikely to affect patient management & a brain scan is unnecessary.</items>
          <items id="description">Dementia screening bloods are normal (where clinically appropriate and patient consents to bloods).</items>
          <items id="text">Investigations</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0009">
          <items id="description">An acute underlying cause to explain confusion i.e. delirium (acute confusional state) has been excluded. Also confirmation whether mood disorder or psychosis is also confirmed or excluded.</items>
          <items id="text">Exclusion criteria</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0010">
          <items id="description">History of gradual cognitive decline is not confirmed by staff, relatives and medical records.</items>
          <items id="text">False</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0011">
          <items id="description">History of gradual cognitive decline is confirmed by staff, relatives and medical records.</items>
          <items id="text">True</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0012">
          <items id="description">Blood tests screening for other causes are normal.</items>
          <items id="text">True</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0013">
          <items id="description">Blood tests indicate other causes.</items>
          <items id="text">False</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0014">
          <items id="description">Acute underlying causes to explain confusion have been excluded.</items>
          <items id="text">True</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0015">
          <items id="description">There are acute underlying causes to explain confusion.</items>
          <items id="text">False</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0022">
          <items id="description">The overall interpretation of the assessment, i.e. a coded statement of whether the assessment indicates a likely diagnosis of dementia or not.</items>
          <items id="text">Interpretation</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0023">
          <items id="description">Blood tests screening for other causes have not been done.</items>
          <items id="text">Not done</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0024">
          <items id="description">Narrative statement why screening blood tests have not been done, e.g. patient declined or clinically inappropriate.</items>
          <items id="text">Reason why bloods not done</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0029">
          <items id="description">The assessment indicates that a diagnosis of dementia is likely.</items>
          <items id="text">Diagnosis of dementia likely</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0030">
          <items id="description">The assessment indicates that a diagnosis of dementia is uncertain and may require further assessment.</items>
          <items id="text">Diagnosis of dementia uncertain</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0031">
          <items id="description">*</items>
          <items id="text">Not assessed</items>
        </term_definitions>
        <term_definitions code="at0032">
          <items id="description">*</items>
          <items id="text">New element</items>
        </term_definitions>

request.description:
Implementation Notes

This call allows uploading openEHR operational templates prepared by the openEHR modelling tools.


Response Messages


201	Success.

400	Invalid content (unable to read opt) (TMPL-3602).

401	Unauthenticated - could not authenticate user (SYS-9401).

403	Forbidden - the user does not have the required permissions to execute this request (SYS-9403).
